item.description: Users will create ordered lists which will be combined to produce new ordered lists personalized for individual users by Skuld, the fate concerned with the future ...

item.title: Kaup
item.description: There is a huge quantity of unowned resources travelling through the couriers‚Äô network. Kaup is the interface for users to describe their desires, peruse the available offerings and schedules, and to ultimately select what they want to receive.

item.title: Revolution
item.description: Funding Initially the funds to support the software development that is at the core of the revolution come from establishing a reliable and violence-averse market for all sorts of ...

item.title: Hestia
item.description: Hestia is a system for managing short term leases on specific locations targeted down to the level of a single room, or even piece of furniture. One of the initial testbeds will be the first Silver outpost.

item.title: V√°r
item.description: V√°r, the Norse goddess of witnessing, is the namesake of the dashcam used by the couriers to: Record their driving performance. Get directions to their next stop.

item.title: Thirteen Thirteens
item.description: Thirteen thirteens draws it‚Äôs name from an organization of teams that are competing and cooperating to divvy up control of spaces and access to resources ...

item.title: Ladon
item.description: In Norse mythology, Ladon is the dragon who guards the golden apples of immortality, which keep the gods youthful. In the systems of software that is Yggdrasil, Nike keeps track of goods as they move through the courier system & Ladon aids people who run holding locations to manage their resources.

item.title: Serial Mobbing
item.description: ![[svg.svg | center | 300]] A Serial Mob is akin to a pair programming session. In pair programming there‚Äôs a Navigator who describes the program to write and the Driver who operates the UI and does the physical writing.
